sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"害怕的，怕的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: afraid, fearful, awful, dreadful, frightful, terrible, horrible, terrific, appalling
means: afraid ：指由于胆小或怯懦而不敢说或做某事。
fearful ：普通用词，既指外界情况变化而引起的恐惧，又指来自内心的害怕与焦虑。
awful ：指威严得令人害怕或敬畏，有一定的感情色彩。
dreadful ：指使人非常恐惧，毛骨悚然，也使人感到讨厌而退缩。
frightful ：指使人陷入短暂的惊恐或产生毛骨悚然的感觉。
terrible ：侧重指给人以长久的惊骇，极端的恐怖，令人难以忍受。
horrible ：指因骇人听闻的丑恶而令人毛骨悚然，着重厌恶的成分多于害怕。
terrific ：多指外表、形状或力量等的可怕。
appalling ：指既令害怕又使人惊异、胆寒。

高中英语新课程标准词汇表 ... terminal a. （火车，汽车，飞机的）终点站 terrible a. 可怕的；糟糕的 terrify vt. 使人感到恐怖.
feelinglm的博客 - feelinglm - 网易博客 ... The performance is merely fair 性能尚好 Terrible 极坏的，很糟的 So so 马马虎虎.

list.abs: 素有恐怖顽童(enfant terrible)之称的 Gaultier 如此翻转成规、挑战性别的界线，前卫而大胆的手法让他横跨时尚和次文化领域，包括设 …
...land Rape) 的系列设计，他因此又被称做“可怕顽童”(enfant terrible) 和“英国时尚界流氓”(the hooligan of English fashion) 。
彼得·费辛利_百度百科 ... 弧形 Arc 不伦之恋 Enfants terribles 木乃伊前传——蝎子王 The Scorpion King.
1000实用英语口语短句循环朗读速记 - 豆丁网 ... That' s life. 这就是生活。 That' s terrible. 真糟糕！ The deuce. 糟糕。.
惊吓英语句子 ... That's spooky! 阴森森的！ That's terrible! 好恐怖！ How awful! 可怕噢！.
许多人谈到「可怕的两岁」（terrible two），都以为孩子过了两岁生日才开始。事实上，可怕的两岁，指的是孩子十八个月到三岁左右。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'causing terror'): via French from Latin terribilis, from terrere 'frighten'

entry.tran: 非常严重的;骇人的;糟糕的
entry.def: A terrible experience or situation is very serious or very unpleasant.

example.ex: Tens of thousands more suffered terrible injuries in the world's worst industrial disaster...
example.tran: 还有成千上万的人在那场全世界最严重的工业灾难中受了重伤。

example.ex: I often have the most terrible nightmares...

entry.tran: (感觉或看起来)病得很重的，心情很糟的
entry.def: If you feel terrible, you feel extremely ill or unhappy. If you tell someone that they look terrible, you mean that they look as if they are extremely ill or unhappy.

example.ex: He did feel terrible at the time but seems to be fine now...
example.tran: 他当时确实很难受，但现在似乎好了。

example.ex: Are you all right? You look terrible. Are you sick?
example.tran: 你没事儿吧？你的脸色很难看，生病了吗？

entry.def: If something is terrible, it is very bad or of very poor quality.

example.ex: She admits her French is terrible.
example.tran: 她承认自己的法语很蹩脚。

entry.tran: (用来加强语气)十足的，极度的，不折不扣的
entry.def: You use terrible to emphasize the great extent or degree of something.

example.ex: I was a terrible fool, you know. I remember that now...
example.tran: 你知道，我那时愚蠢至极。我至今还记得。

example.ex: Her death is a terrible waste.

means.word_mean: 1. causing fear or dread or terror;

sentences.sentence: "a career or vengeance so direful that London was shocked"
"polio is no longer the dreaded disease it once was"
"an unspeakable odor came sweeping into the room"

means.word_mean: 3. intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree or quality;

sentences.sentence: "under wicked fire from the enemy's guns"

auth_sentence.content: This was a terrible mistake, Mr Ivens said.
auth_sentence.res_content: This was a terrible mistake, Mr Ivens said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This was a terrible mistake, Mr Ivens said.

auth_sentence.content: But what a terrible waste of a great band.
auth_sentence.res_content: But what a terrible waste of a great band.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But what a terrible waste of a great band.

auth_sentence.content: I think it is pretty terrible stuff going on.
auth_sentence.res_content: I think it is pretty terrible stuff going on.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think it is pretty terrible stuff going on.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =earth,表示"土地"; 2. =frighten,可怕,恐惧; 3. =frighten,表示"恐,怕"

stems_affixes.value_cn: [comeing from]地球外的, 宇宙的[outside the earth]
stems_affixes.word_buile: extra外+terrestrial[adj.地球的，地球上的]→adj.[comeing from]地球外的, 宇宙的[outside the earth]
mediterranean而来→n.地中海 adj.地中海的
subterrane[n.下层; 洞穴, 地下室]+ean→adj.地下的
terr土地+estrial→adj.地球的，地球上的
territory[n.领土;版图;领域,范围]+ial……的→territorial领土的
deter[v.威慑,吓住]+ent……的→deterrent威慑的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 很糟的;可怕的,骇人的;极度的,厉害的
stems_affixes.word_buile: terr恐,怕+ible可..的→可怕的
terr恐,怕+ific产生……的→带来可怕→好到让人可怕的地步→极好的
extra外+territorial[adj.领土的,土地的,地方的]+ity表名词→n.治外法权
mediterranean而来→n.地中海 adj.地中海的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 下层; 洞穴, 地下室
stems_affixes.word_buile: sub下面+terr土地+ane→n.下层; 洞穴, 地下室
terr土地+ace→n.平台,阳台,露台
terr土地+ain表名词→n.地势,地形
terr土地+it+ory场所,范围→地的范围,领土
deter[v.威慑,吓住]+ment表名词→n.制止

stems_affixes.value_cn: 恐怖, 可怕的人, 恐怖时期, 恐怖行动
stems_affixes.word_buile: terr恐,怕+or表名词→n.恐怖, 可怕的人, 恐怖时期, 恐怖行动
terror恐怖+ist人→n.恐怖分子
dis离,出+inter埋→v.挖出,掘土
in进+ter=terr土地→v.埋葬
de去+ter=terr恐,怕→吓跑了,吓得不动了
terr恐,怕+ify使……→v.使害怕,使惊恐

Sentence.sentence: It was terrible at first, especially getting up before dawn to catch that 6:30 train.
Yes, but I was going to say I thought the acting was terrible.

In an interview with the Paris Review Hughes speculated that when a person puts pen to paper, "you meet the terrible resistance of what happened your first year at it, when you couldn't write at all".
What a terrible memory you have!

means.word_mean: 可怕的, 恐怖的; 令人震惊的, 极其令人讨厌的

sentences.en: The little boy is playing the terrible game.
sentences.cn: 那小男孩正在玩恐怖的游戏。

sentences.en: It is terrible that she lost her wallet.
sentences.cn: 糟透了, 她丢失了钱包。

jushi.english: It was a terrible accident, but we did not panic.
jushi.chinese: 这是一桩骇人的意外事故,但我们没有惊慌失措。

jushi.english: He stood aghast at the terrible sight.
jushi.chinese: 他被眼前的可怕景象吓呆了。

jushi.english: He's a terrible man when he's angry.
jushi.chinese: 他这个人生气时令人生畏。
